conclusion: To determine the direction of the acceleration of the skydiver during the interval from 0 to 10 seconds, we can analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph provided.
The graph shows the velocity v on the y-axis and time t on the x-axis.
The slope of the graph at any given point represents the acceleration at that time because acceleration a is the derivative of velocity with respect to time (a = dv/dt).
During the 0 to 10 seconds interval, the velocity increases from 0 to 20 m/s.
The graph shows a positive slope throughout the 0 to 10 seconds interval, indicating that the velocity is increasing over time.
A positive slope on a v-t graph means that the acceleration is positive.
Positive acceleration indicates that the skydiver is speeding up (accelerating) in the direction of motion, which is downward due to gravity.
The direction of the acceleration is downward.
